intro: Navarretia filicaulis, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Navarretia filicaulis is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
